reviews.title: Should this really be #1???
reviews.text: Granted, we only stayed one night but I wonder why Real is considered the best this town has to offer??

reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location.
reviews.text: The location is good. Right outside the city wall where the bulk of the attraction is. The auto garage is a nice feature.

reviews.title: I want to go back!
reviews.text: The staff was friendly enough. Communicative during our reservation process. Helpful during check in and accommodating for early morning departure needs. When asked for dinner recommendations we were given a map of all the restaurants in town and told to choose "which-ever."

reviews.title: Lovely <3
reviews.text: I understand the whole "medieval" theme but the rooms are quite poor. Although it was clean, it was stuffy and a bit smelly, it reminded us of what you might find throughout Europe 20-30 years ago. The beds, linens and bathroom were uncomfortable and tired. Wifi was offered but apparently only reachable in key locations around the property.

reviews.title: Nice old hotel and close to the attractions
reviews.text: The grounds are well maintained and the pool would probably be a nice feature on a hot summer day. They accommodated our early departure with a lovely continental breakfast.
Perhaps the other accomodation in Obidos is not that great, but I would not say that this is a luxe or "to die for" stay - very pleasant, but not stunning.
reviews.title: Bit puzzled by the high rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were pleasant, but tight. At times, there were faint whiffs of dampness - guessing because it's off season and the hotel is not opened up.
reviews.title: A bit of history with all the modern conforts!

reviews.text: The staff wear kitschy historical tunics and rooms are opened by huge old keys, so there is an attempt to be historical-esque.
reviews.title: TRAVEL IN TIME!

reviews.text: The included breakfast is delightful, plentiful and satisfying. Where else can you find huge glass jars filled with candy at breakfast?
reviews.title: very comfortable portuguese hotel with old world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Obidos, the town, is well worth a stop - walking the wall on a beautifully sunny day is a great part of any trip.
reviews.title: We loved this medieval hotel in the fantastic walled city.
Great hotel in a beautiful village with lots of character
reviews.text: We spent the last night of our trip around Portugal here after reading the reviews. And they weren't wrong, this is a really memorable medieval-themed hotel. There are suits of armour and swords all over the place, and quite a lot of medieval style furniture in the rooms. Staff were extremely friendly, and the breakfast was probably the best we had in Portugal. There is also a pool, but unfortunately the weather was not quite good enough to use it!

reviews.title: Great staff and great breakfast
reviews.text: The hotel is just outside the town walls of Obidos, which makes it easy to drive to, as well as easy to explore the town. Obidos is really pretty, but probably best explored in the morning or evening after the coach tours have departed - it feels a lot more authentic wandering the quiet streets after dark. There are also lots of inviting bars and restaurants to explore.

reviews.title: Lived Up to Expectations
reviews.text: The hotel is set up to be medieval and the decor is armour and the like with staff wearing costume. The room keys are big chunky things with a length of chain attached. The weather was not good enough to use the swimming pool but it looked inviting and clean. The room was comfortable and clean and the breakfasts really good. The hotel is at the botoom of the town and the paths are pretty steep so you need to be in good health and have good walking shoes. The only downside was the walls seem thin and we had a noisy occupant next door.

reviews.title: Great hotel in a lovely town
reviews.text: Delightful town and location. The hotel is rated #1 on TA for a reason- the location cannot be beat just outside the town walls (literally steps away) and available parking on the street. The medieval theme is fun and fitting. As previously stated the rooms are lovely; ours had a large four poster bed as well. Breakfast was impressive particularly the fresh squeezed orange juice and champagne for mimosas.

reviews.title: Lovely place in a lovely town
reviews.text: We throughly enjoyed our stay. The town does not really merit more than a one night stay, but you will enjoy the time spent there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent one very pleasant evening here on our recent trip across Spain and Portugal. It is an older property and lacks some of the bells and whistles, but we really enjoyed the medieval ambiance. The room was a bit on the smallish size, but we had a very nice view of the city walls and surrounding countryside. The wi-fi worked great. Our beds were OK and the breakfast was quite good. All the staff with whom we interacted were very helpful and friendly and spoke excellent English. And, we found a parking spot directly in front of the hotel. Obidos is a tad bit over the top touristy but it's really a great deal of fun. We would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Delightful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely medieval setting for the hotel public space. Lots of character. Easy walk into Obidos town. Car park beneath the hotel. Good selection for breakfast.Bedrooms are comfortable. Plenty of cafes and restaurants in Obidos. Lots of tourist coaches during the day, but fairly quiet pm and evening.
reviews.title: Charming hotel set next to castle walls

reviews.text: Stayed with friends for one night. Rooms are not very comfortable. No minibar in the room. In general hotel feels dusty and I do not mean it in a nice way but more towards - worn out/ dated. Receptions staff was not very welcoming.
reviews.title: Overrated
Back in time !
reviews.text: I had great time in Obidos, but next time I will stay in a different hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A real effort was made to make this hotel look like a medieval place, in almost each and every detail. And it works ! It does not look like fake medevial, not like some Disney place... Apart from that, it's conveniently located, especially if you come by car (and there is a private parking). Our standard room (105) was not very big, but is was under the roof, which means no noise coming from above. The bathroom was spacious, with bath tub and very hot water. Staff was very kind and helpful, speaking perfect english. And the breakfast was one of the most complete we ever had in this category of hotel. Of course you don't sleep inside the walls, with no nice view, but that means you don't pay for the view...
reviews.title: somewhat disappointed
Loved this hotel!
reviews.text: We arrived in Obidos with no reservation and pulled up in front of this hotel. Being the off season, March, we were able to get a room. The staff was so friendly and helped us during our two night stay. The breakfast was amazing- so much food and lots of variety. The room had a view of the old city and out into the country side. It was quiet and so relaxing. We were steps from the city walls. This is a great find for a hotel and I recommend it highly.

reviews.title: good location, but definitely room for improvement
reviews.text: We spent 1 night at this hotel, during a 2 week trip through Portugal. The hotel is well located & very clean, with a modern bath. They have a secure parking garage that we appreciated. It has a midieval decor, but that makes the room somewhat dark. The staff was OK, but nothing special. Breakfast buffet was just ok--not nearly as extensive or delicious as where we stayed in Evora, and the eggs were ice cold. What annoyed us most was the "nickel & dime" attitude--- for example--- if you want to use the robes they provide-- it is an add'l 10 euros/night. They offer wi-fi, but you only get 30 minutes free--- why ?? They could do a lot more with this hotel, and we were surprised at our experience for a place that was rated 1st on TripAdvisor.

reviews.title: over hyped and over priced
reviews.text: phoned to book and asked if there was a swimming pool so confirmed booking arrived 3 hours later and was told you cannot use the pool ( water quality ? ) . the smell of chemical air freshner was repulsive an appeared to me to be to disguise an overall sanitation/ water/plumbing problem in the hotel

reviews.title: Swim with a stunning close-up view of Obidos medieval walls!
reviews.text: This hotel is just two blocks outside the medieval wall (you can see the wall entry from the hotel entrance) and has parking (though they wouldn't reserve it for us, we arrived at 4 p.m mid-September and got parking at the hotel). Service is graciously friendly, and the bathroom is up to normal Portuguese standards of immaculate cleanliness.

reviews.title: Great themed interior, loved it
reviews.text: The medieval theme extends to large,clunky, noisy keys and a bit of fustiness, but this hotel is a find, with a good breakfast buffet, and a lovely sunny rooftop terrace with pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only write good things about this hotel: the location is just next to the walls in the beautiful village of Óbidos; the rooms are clean and comfortable and breakfast is also varied and plentiful. For those who are travelling by car the parking within the building of the hotel is free and the staff is very friendly. But the best thing comes when you leave the hotel in the morning and you only have to pay 75€, which I´m sure is excellent value for money. In short I recommend this hotel to everyone (especially if you get an offer like ours)
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we loved the Hotel Real, very close to town walls.
reviews.title: gem of an hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff were all pleasant, well trained and very helpful. we were on a B+B package and loved the varied and plentiful breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent option - right outside the walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We, a retired couple, stayed here for one night at the end if June 2012. The hotel is situated in a great location immediately outside one of the gates into this jewel of a town, just minutes from everything. Being outside the walls, it alleviated the problem with access and parking that exists for hotels inside the old town. The hotel is a charming place, full of antiques in the hallways, and in the furniture in the very nice bedroom, which was large with a good queen bed and a good-sized clean bathroom with a good shower. There are armored knights and crossbows at every corner, and shields and tapestries hanging from the walls. The staff wear medieval costumes. We parked in the underground parking (included) and later in the day rested a while at the pleasant pool. There was a good full breakfast included with lots of options - hot and cold - and free wifi. This hotel is an excellent option for price, service and location.
reviews.title: You like it or not

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is somewhat special. Our room was okay but very sober. It felt like being in a convent. The big room key-on-a-chain and the costumes worn by the staff added to the experience. It was much overdone.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Obidos
